import React from 'react'; import { Container, Accordion, Card } from "react-bootstrap"; import { Link } from "react-router-dom"; import DocumentMeta from 'react-document-meta'; import "bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.css"; import "./Services.css"; import HomeCarousel from '../components/HomeCarousel'; function NursingJobInNetherlands() { // const [modalShow, setModalShow] = React.useState(false); const meta = { title: 'Nursing Jobs in Netherland | Staff Nursing Jobs in Netherland for Indians', description: 'Nursing Jobs in Netherland. Nursing in Netherland is classified into two levels where the 1st level nurse determine the proper level of nurse care required for the patient & the 2nd level nurses work under the first level nurse.', canonical: 'https://www.mbbsadmissionsinabroad.com/nursing-jobs-in-netherlands', meta: { charset: 'utf-8', name: { keywords: 'Nursing Job In Netherlands' } } }; return (

Nursing Job In Netherlands

Nursing jobs in Netherland are becoming very lucrative owing to its integrated health care structure. Nursing in Netherland is classified into two levels where the 1st level nurse determines the proper level of nurse care required for the patient & the 2nd level nurses work under the first level nurse. Staff Nursing Job in Netherland has become very inspiring with the new and improved health structure.

  • Index
  • Types of Nursing Jobs in Netherlands
  • How to apply for a nursing job in Netherland?
  • How to Get a Nursing Job In Netherland
  • Nurses vacancy in Netherland
  • Requirement of nurse’s vacancy in Netherland 2020
  • Salary for a Nurse in Netherland
  • FAQ Nursing Job in Netherland
  • Testimonials

Types of Nursing Jobs in Netherlands

There are various nursing opportunities existing throughout the year with a number of hospitals both private and public such as:

  • Peritoneal dialysis nurse
  • General nurse
  • Charge nurse
  • Nurse consultants
  • Private nurse
  • Emergency nursing
  • Dialysis nursing
  • Oncology nursing
  • Anesthesia nursing
  • Occupational health nursing
  • Burns nursing
  • I.C.U. nursing for adult/children
  • Cardiac care nursing
  • Operation Theater Nurse and many more.

How to apply for a nursing job in Netherland?

If the candidate applies for the Nursing Jobs in Netherland, she needs to arrange the following documents for the process and every application documents need to be notarized:

  • CV/Resume
  • Health Certificate
  • Professional passport size photograph
  • Work experience certificates (if any)
  • Danish language certificate
  • Certificate of the registered nurse
  • Secondary schooling or equivalent
  • Higher Secondary or equivalent
  • Professional qualification certificate
  • Curricular of the professional qualification
  • Consolidated mark sheets from the university or college (if the coursework completed)
  • Provisional certificate (If available)
  • Photocopy of passport (front and back page)

How to Get a Nursing Job In Netherland

The candidate needs to qualify the following criteria to get a Nursing Job in the Netherland:

  • The candidate must have a B.Sc or a post-graduation degree in nursing to apply for nursing jobs in Netherland.
  • The candidate should be registered with the BIG register which is a subsidiary of the Individual Healthcare Professions Act.
  • Once the registration complete, the candidate must obtain a work permit in Netherlands.
  • A nurse in Netherlands needs to work for 7 to 8 hours a day.

Nurses vacancy in Netherland

Netherland has lots of nurses vacancy and it is great to be a nurse in Netherland because of the following reasons:

  • The candidate get a good amount of salary by working for 7 to 8 hours a day.
  • The candidate will get regulated holiday periods and various additional benefits such as yearly bonus & more.

Requirement of nurse’s vacancy in Netherland 2020

The candidate needs to fulfill the following requirements to apply for Nursing Jobs in Netherland:

  • The candidate needs to be able to speak English fluently at least a B2 or C1 level.
  • The candidate must also have a basic grasp of Dutch at A1 level.
  • If the candidate is from outside the EU, then need a Dutch working permit before starting this whole process.

Salary for a Nurse in Netherland

A nurse can earn between €1790 and €3370 per month that depends on the level of experience and how many hours she works. The average monthly salary for a nurse in the Netherland is €2725. Apart from this, a nurse will also get end-of-year bonuses and holiday pay. Moreover, she will also get extra for working on weekends & on holidays.

FAQ Nursing Job in Netherland
How possible it to get a nursing job in Netherland?

  • The candidate must have a European nursing degree.
  • The candidate should also have a good command of the English or German language at A2 level.
  • It is important to have a valid working permit in the Netherlands or a European nationality.

 Is it good to be a nurse in Netherland?

Of course yes, Netherland is a great place to work as a nurse and it is really in need of more nursing staff as well. It provides good salary package, regulated holiday periods, and various additional benefits such as bonus, & more.

 How can I work as a nurse assistant in Netherland?

The candidate can easily work as a staff nurse in Netherland by submitting a B.Sc degree, proof of work experience, and other necessary documents such as Dutch language certificate.

 What is the requirement of nurses in Netherland?

  • The candidate needs to be able to speak English fluently at least a B2 or C1 level.
  • The candidate must also have a basic grasp of Dutch at A1 level.
  • If the candidate is from outside the EU, then need a Dutch working permit before starting this whole process.

 Is it possible to get a nursing job in Netherland without IELTS?

It is necessary that the candidate speaks, read and write English well. She must have passed an English language test such as IELTS and TOEFL.

 Is it possible to get a nursing job in Netherland with 1 year of experience?

Nurses are eligible to work in Netherland with 1 year of experience but must have a Dutch language certificate.

 Which language skill do I require to get a job in Netherland as a nurse?

The candidate must have a basic grasp of Dutch at A1 level.

 Are there any jobs for a nursing diploma in Netherland?

Netherland allows nurses from various countries to get Nursing Jobs in Netherland. There are lots of vacancies of nurses in the Netherland which is the best opportunity for Indian nurses.
Testimonials
